column1: {{quote|Death to the Forgoil! Death to the Strawheads! Death to the robbers from the North!|Dunlendings<ref>{{TT|Deep}}</ref>}}

column2: or the '''Strawheads''' as it reportedly translated in [[Westron]]
column3: were the enemies of the [[Dunlendings]]. In the rest of Middle-earth

column1: ''Forgoil'' is the only known word in the language of the Dunlendings. It is possible that the final part of the word
column4: such as in the case of [[Westron]] ''il'' cf. ''[[mûmakil]]'' (which is perhaps [[Haradric]]); similar formation with the ending ''-li'' is also seen in [[Quenya]].<ref>[[Helge Fauskanger]]
column6: [[Ardalambion]]</ref> There is also a possibility of a plural formation with infixion from *''forgol''

column1: The (possible) element ''go'' has been tied to the [[Pre-Númenórean]] word ''[[Go-hilleg]]''
column6: but refers to the [[Númenóreans|Númenórean settlers]]. It could mean "head"
column10: both these interpretations remain speculation; [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] never left any notes on the subject.
